info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 5:08PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Jackson and northwestern Larimer Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 507 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pearl, or 53 miles southwest of Laramie, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pearl, Cowdrey, Four Corners and Glendevey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
